name: VisualWriter
cognitiveStyle: Prefers spatial organization, visual grouping, and non-linear exploration
description: Users who think in images and spatial relationships; benefit from mind maps, diagrams, and kanban boards
historySnippets: Uses kanban to track subtopics and progress
Often starts with divergent exploration before convergent writing
source: Synthetic profile based on cognitive style literature (Riding & Cheema, 1991)

name: LinearWriter
cognitiveStyle: Prefers hierarchical outlines, sequential drafting, and structured progression
description: Users who think in sequences and hierarchies; benefit from outlines, checklists, and focused editors
historySnippets: Starts with outlines and moves linearly through sections
Uses stats to track progress toward goals
source: Synthetic profile based on cognitive style literature (Riding & Cheema, 1991)

name: ResearchWriter
cognitiveStyle: Hybrid style emphasizing source management and synthesis
description: Users focused on academic research who need both source tracking and thematic organization
historySnippets: Uses AI to identify gaps in literature
typicalWorkflows: collect sources → cluster themes → synthesize → write
source: Synthetic profile based on academic writing research (Wang et al., 2025 ScholaWrite)
